text: The UNSULLIED stand in formation, immobile. Their phalanx are eight men deep and thirty men long, and their line stretches nearly a mile. GREY WORM stands at the head of the central phalanx. He l ahead, to the walls of King’s Landing. EXT. KING’S LANDING BATTLEMENTS - DAY We see the Unsullied from a high, distant perspective: BRONN’s perspective, specifically, as he inspects the LANNISTER FORCES on the city walls. This is what a true Lannister deployment looks like: a li of soldiers stretching into the distance as far as the ey can see, prepared for an attack from any point. Bronn looks over the battlement to see many more men at t ready in the courtyard below, where many barrels are also being stacked. A LANNISTER GENERAL on the battlements supervises the bar stacking. Bronn questions the man:
Oil?
Pitch, my lord. Bronn looks at the barrels in the courtyard.
How many barrels?
Five hundred, my lord. Bronn looks out at the Unsullied.
Get five hundred more.
Yes, my lord. The general leaves to see to his order. Bronn continues d the battlements, to JAIME LANNISTER. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 2.
I still enjoy it when they call me “my lord.”
The thrill will fade. Bronn looks out at the Unsullied.
If we live that long. They both look out at the Unsullied for a moment.
Men without cocks. Wouldn’t find me fighting in an army if I had no cock. What's left to fight for?
Gold?
I spent my life around soldiers. What do you think they spend that gold on? Point taken.
Family?
Not without a cock, you don’t. Hmm.
Maybe it really is all cocks in the end.
(re: Unsullied) And yet, your brother has chosen to side with the cockless.
Yes, he’s always been a champion of the downtrodden. A trumpet sounds from a tower above. Jaime and Bronn retu their attention to the distance.  GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 3.

The DOTHRAKI HORDE breaks the horizon and heads toward th city, 10,000 screamers strong. The Dothraki pour through the gaps in the Unsullied phalanxes; their passage does not cause a single Unsullie flinch. EXT. KING’S LANDING BATTLEMENTS - DAY The Dothraki present their customary show of strength bef the city walls, a cyclone of horse and steel and screamin warriors, swirling before the immobile Unsullied. And then, without warning or apparent signal, they stop i front of the Unsullied and fall silent, in ready position eerily motionless, staring up at the nervous defenders of city.
I think we’re about to be the downtrodden.

TYRION LANNISTER stands on the starboard deck of Dany’s flagship, standing next to VARYS and THEON GREYJOY. He steps away from them, heading toward the bow, where JO SNOW stands with DAVOS SEAWORTH. Tyrion joins them. The three men look at King’s Landing, the distance. Nearby JORAH MORMONT and MISSANDEI look across the water, the few escort ships following behind their flagship. Dany herself is notably absent.
How many people live here?
A million, give or take. Jon tries to get his head around this notion.
That’s more people than we have in the entire North. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 4.
Crammed into that. Why would anyone want to live that way?
There’s more work in the city. And the brothels are far superior.

In a dark storage area below decks, amidst various crates sacks of food, THE HOUND approaches a crate that is separ from the rest. The top is padlocked on two sides. He stands in front of it and listens to the silence. He raises a finger, and taps the crate once, quietly. A barrage of thumping and snarling explodes from inside t crate, shaking it on the floorboards. Satisfied that their precious cargo is undead and well, t Hound walks away.
CERSEI LANNISTER has heard news from QYBURN. Jaime is als present. THE MOUNTAIN stands at his post nearby, silent a always.
Why isn’t she with them?
I'm afraid I don’t know, your grace. No one has seen her.
And the rest of them?
They're on their way to the Dragonpit now.
Including our brother?
Yes, your grace. Cersei approaches the Mountain. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 5.

If anything goes wrong, kill the silver-haired bitch first. Then our brother, then the bastard who calls himself king. The rest of them you can kill in any order you see fit. Ser Gregor nods. Both Jaime and Qyburn appear troubled.
Come, Ser Gregor. It’s time for us to meet our guests. Ser Gregor opens the door. Cersei leaves her chambers. Ja Qyburn and Gregor follow.

Tyrion, Jon and company approach on the main road: Davos, Varys, Missandei, Jorah, Theon. QHONO and nine other DOTH march with them, keeping a watchful eye. They wear the bu torn, bloodied coats of Lannister officers they murdered ep.704. The Hound brings up the rear of the procession, walking alongside a donkey cart, which carries the padlocked crat seen in the hold of the ship previously. Dany is still no here. Missandei looks up, and sees a foreboding piece of the Dragonpit peeking above the foliage line.
Why did they build it?
Dragons don’t understand the difference between what’s theirs and what isn’t. Land, livestock. Children. Letting them roam free around a city was a problem.

I imagine it was a sad joke at the end. That entire colossal arena, for a few sickly creatures smaller than dogs. But in the beginning, when it was home to Balerion the Dread... Tyrion looks up at the visible section of the Dragonpit a they approach a bend, and speaks with admiration: (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 6.
It must have been the most dangerous place in the world. Davos isn’t looking up; he’s looking straight ahead.

Maybe it still is. A contingent of TWENTY LANNISTER GUARDS has rounded the b and is heading their way, led by Bronn. Also in tow: BRIENNE and PODRICK PAYNE. They’re walking o their own, but the three guards on Brienne and one on Pod make it clear that they are guests of the nation. Our group stops. The Dothraki get ready to fight, but Tyr waves them down. They wait for Bronn to approach. All are surprised to see Brienne and Pod here. But no one more surprised than the Hound.

Welcome, my lords. (re: Brienne and Pod) Your friends arrived before you did. I’ve been sent to escort you all to the meeting. They follow Bronn -- but Pod stays behind, face to face w Tyrion. Neither man thought they’d ever see the other aga
A pleasant surprise in an unpleasant situation. Pod fully agrees.
I never thought I’d see you again, my lord.
Supporting the enemy, no less.
Hard to blame you.
Cersei will anyway.
I’m glad you’re alive. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 7.
The Lannister rear guard is upon them. Their faces tell Tyrion and Pod that it’s time to move on -- and Bronn approaches to do the same:
Come on. You can suck his magic cock later. Tyrion smiles. He’s missed these lads.
Our group walks onward, toward the Dragonpit, the Lannist guards outnumbering the Dothraki more than two-to-one. A Lannister guard walks close behind the Hound. Too close
What’s in there? The Hound looks the man in the eye.

Fuck off. The guard is old enough to have a healthy fear of Joffrey mad dog. He doesn’t push. The Hound stays with his cart, looking ahead of him to Brienne, the woman who almost killed him. Brienne looks back at him. Brienne slows down, allowing t Hound to catch up alongside her. He throws her a sideways glance, then looks back to his Lannister friend. The guard falls back, letting them speak privately. The H returns his gaze forward.
I thought you were dead.
Not yet. You came pretty close. They walk in silence for a moment.
I was only trying to protect her.
You and me both. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf"
She's alive. Arya. The Hound has not heard this yet.
Where?
Winterfell.
Who's protecting her, if you’re here? Brienne smiles.
The only one who needs protecting is the one who gets in her way. A rare smile from the Hound.
Won’t be me. Tyrion, Varys, Pod and Bronn walk together, near the fron The first three are acutely aware of the tension inherent this situation. Bronn is also, though he pretends not to
Here we are. The Heroes of Blackwater Bay. Strange place for a reunion.
It is, my lord.
I don’t think I’m anyone’s lord anymore, Podrick. Save the titles for Ser Bronn of the Blackwater.
I’m sure your new queen will be happy to restore yours, if she ends up on the throne.
You've been thinking about our new queen. (beat) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 9.
Perhaps you’ve been reconsidering your allegiances. Remember my offer, whatever they’re paying you, I’ll pay double.
And that would be double what, now, exactly?
Don’t you worry about me. I’m doing all right. Looking after myself.
Are you? Helping me to arrange this meeting wasn’t exactly looking after yourself, was it? You put yourself at risk.

I put yourself at risk. Important difference. It’s your head Queen Cersei’s offered a bag of gold for, it’s not mine. Now, thanks to me, she’s got two traitors’ heads coming right through her door. She can lop them both off, as soon as she gets tired of the clever words that pour out their pieholes. All thanks to Ser Bronn of the Fucking Blackwater. If that’s not looking after myself, I don’t know what is. They walk in silence for a long tense beat, as Tyrion stu Bronn.
It’s good to see you again. Bronn smiles in spite of himself.
Yeah. You too. The Hound unlatches his cart from the donkey, and turns t his Lannister guard.
Anyone touches it, I’1l kill you first. Sometimes, being a Lannister guard is just no fun at all. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 10.
They all enter the Dragonpit.

They enter the ruins of an architectural marvel, detritus scattered around the edges. The weight of history stays their tongues. That, and the twenty more LANNISTER GUARDS stationed in the stands. The take in the scene as Bronn leads them to their seats. Cersei has not made fancy preparations. Just the appropri number of chairs, grouped according to allegiances, with pergola to shade them from the sun. Cersei’s chairs are on the end, facing the entrance. Her chair is larger and more ornate than the rest. To Cersei’s right, there are six chairs for Dany’s group; Bronn motions Tyrion in that direction. To Cersei’s left, there are three chairs for Jon’s group; Bronn motions Jon in that direction. They make their way to their appointed chairs, but do not sit. The Dothraki all fall in behind Dany’s chairs, leavi Jon, Davos and Brienne hanging in the wind. The Hound sta to Jon's right, nearest to Cersei’s podium. Bronn puts his arm around Pod.

Come on, Pod. Let’s you and me go have a drink while the fancy folks talk. However friendly Bronn’s tone, this is not a request. Pod gives Brienne one last look, and exits through a side entrance with Bronn. The twenty Lannister guards that escorted them into the Dragonpit remain, however, in formation on either side of entrance through which they came. Our group exchange glances. The bulk of the glances are a at Tyrion. The Hound approaches him.
I left this shit city because I didn’t want to die in it. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 11.
Am I going to die in this shit city?
You might.
And this was all your idea. Tyrion looks around at the Lannisters who may murder them Honesty forces him to nod. The Hound takes a breath.
Seems every bad idea has some Lannister cunt behind it.

And some Clegane cunt to help them see it through. The sound of armored men marching draws all their attenti back to the entrance. The marching grows louder and loude EXT. DRAGONPIT - MAIN FLOOR - CERSEI’S ARRIVAL - CONTINUO The Mountain enters first, running point on Cersei and he entourage: Jaime, Qyburn, Euron. The entirety of her QUEENSGUARD (6) surrounds them. Ten more LANNISTER GUARDS bring up the rear, for good measure. The Hound recognizes the Mountain on sight. Without hesitation, Cersei heads toward her seat, veering toward Jon's side of the Dragonpit. Jon watches her, trying not to look out of his element. Jaime passes right by Brienne. His expression asks her wh the hell she’s doing here, but unfortunately this is a question her expression is incapable of answering. Cersei’s gaze goes to Tyrion. Who killed her mother, who killed her father, who is now wearing the Hand pin of Cersei’s nemesis. Euron is smiling, always smiling, especially at Theon. The Hound steps away from his post behind Brienne and wal directly toward Cersei’s riser. The Mountain steps out in front of his Queen and onto the ground. Nobody else moves (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 12.
The Hound’s hand is nowhere near his sword. As far as he concerned, none of them are even here. Only the Mountain.
Remember me? He looks into the Mountain’s dead eyes.

Yeah. You do. (looks closer) You're even fucking uglier than I am now. What did they do to you? (no answer) Doesn't matter. That’s not how it ends for you, brother. You know who's coming for you. You've always known. The Mountain has no comment, he turns and walks back to h place behind Cersei. The Hound walks away from them all, toward the door through which he came.
Where is she?
She'll be here soon. Cersei tries to keep her extreme displeasure in check, an nearly succeeds.
Didn't travel with you?

No. Jaime is still looking at Brienne. Cersei notices Jaime looking at Brienne. Brienne looks away, too late. Cersei looks to Jaime, who is saved from having to explai this by a familiar cry that comes from above, and the sou of beating wings. EXT. DRAGONPIT - MAIN FLOOR - DANY’S ARRIVAL - CONTINUOUS The wings grow louder, and soon they’re moving enough air flutter the fabric of the pergola. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 13.

Everyone but Cersei emerges from the pergola in time to s it: Drogon lands on the lip of the Dragonpit, with DAENERYS TARGARYEN on his back, crushing the area where his claws down. Cersei stares at her enemy, this baby-faced usurper who’s come to take what’s hers. Rhaegal circles in the sky overhead. Drogon clambers down the stands a bit; some of the more deteriorated stone crumbles beneath his weight. As Dany climbs out onto his wing, Euron stares at the bea entranced. He looks to Cersei, then back to Dany. By this time, Dany is climbing off Drogon’s wing, to the ground of the Dragonpit. As she makes her way to the gathering, Drogon takes to th air again to join his brother, the two of them rising in gyres to the sky overhead, remaining in sight. Most are cowed by the sight of these beasts, including Da allies. Not Cersei. All she displays is disdain for the theatrica of the gesture. Jon Snow sits. Davos and Brienne follow suit. Dany arrives at her chair and sits. All her people follow suit. This gathering represents almost all the power in the liv world, and they are all aware of it. No one is in a rush speak the first word, because bosses don’t rush.
We've been here for some time.
My apologies. Dany nods to Tyrion. Tyrion stands.
We are all facing a unique-- From his seat, Euron interrupts Tyrion. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 14.
Theon: I have your sister. If you don't submit to me here and now, I'll kill her. Tyrion looks to Jaime: who the fuck is this guy? Jaime's expression tells him that Jaime is not a fan.
I think we ought to begin with larger concerns.
Then why are you talking? You're the smallest concern here. Euron rises from his seat and approaches Tyrion. Tyrion turns to Theon.
Do you remember when we discussed dwarf jokes?
His wasn’t even good.
He explained it at the end. Never explain, it always ruins it.
We don’t even let your kind live in the Iron Islands, you know. We kill you at birth. An act of mercy for the parents.
(to Euron) Perhaps you ought to sit down.
Why? Cersei deals with Euron before he can derail things furth
Sit down or leave. The Mountain steps forward and stares at Euron. Euron’s smile wavers a bit, and he sits. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 15.

We are a group of people who do not like one another, as this recent demonstration has shown. (beat) We have suffered at each other’s hands. We have lost people we love at each other’s hands. If all we wanted was more of the same, there would be no need for this gathering. We are entirely capable of waging war against each other without meeting face to face.
So instead we're going to settle our differences and live together in harmony for the rest of our days.
We all know that will never happen.
Then why are we here? Jon stands.

This isn’t about living in harmony. It’s just about living. The same thing is coming for all of us: a general you can’t negotiate with. An army that doesn’t leave corpses behind on the battlefield. (beat) Lord Tyrion tells me a million people live in this city. They're about to become a million more soldiers in the Army of the Dead.
I imagine for most of them it would be an improvement.
This is serious. I wouldn't be here if it weren't.
I don't think it's serious at all. I think it's another bad joke. (to Dany) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 16.
If my brother Jaime has informed me correctly, you're asking me for a truce.
Yes. That’s all.

That’s all. Pull my armies back and stand down while you go on your monster hunt. Or while you solidify and expand your position. Hard for me to know which it is, with my armies pulled back. Until you return and march on my capital with four times the men.
Your capital will be safe until the Northern threat is dealt with. You have my word.
The word of a would-be usurper. Dany doesn’t like that word, but before she can escalate, Tyrion speaks:
There is no conversation that will erase the past fifty years. (to Cersei and Jaime) We have something to show you. EXT. DRAGONPIT - MAIN FLOOR - HOUND’S ARRIVAL - A FEW MOM

We follow the Hound into the Dragonpit; the crate he brou in on the cart is now on his back, secured with ropes. He brings the crate into the middle of the space between summit factions and puts it down. He throws the ropes asi He unlocks the padlocks and takes it off. He opens the to and steps back. Everyone watches the open crate. People crane their necks trying to see over the lip of the crate. Nothing happens. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 17.

Jon is worried. If this thing doesn’t do what it’s suppos to, this whole gathering has been for naught. Impatient, the Hound kicks over the crate, knocking it on it’s side. The WIGHT bolts out of his casket. He no longer wears his winter clothing, only scraps of cl that reveal the rotting mess of his body, and the holes w the Hound slammed him down on Drogon’s spikes. He has a m collar around his neck... .+. but we don’t have a chance to properly register this he’s making for Cersei, snarling and gnashing. Cersei recoils. Feeling no undead camaraderie with the creature whatever, Mountain draws his sword and steps to Cersei’s side, read slice the thing in two. The creature is almost upon Cersei. It reaches for her -- -- and is roughly jerked to the ground. The Hound holds the chain attached to the wight’s collar, we probably didn’t notice until now. The other end of the chain is secured to the bottom of the crate. The wight comes for the Hound. The Hound draws his sword and cuts the wight neatly in ha right through the waist. Its legs continue kicking. The sight has the desired effect on everyone. They are se something that many of them thought was impossible. Cerse and Jaime try to process what they’re seeing. As does Brienne. The wight’s torso keeps coming for the Hound, crawling ov the ground, shattered teeth gnashing. The Hound chops an arm off at the elbow. The arm keeps flexing and grasping. The demonstration shakes Cersei in a way few things can. And though Tyrion is seeing this for the first time as we he spends more time watching Cersei than he does watching wight itself. Noting her reaction. Everyone who has never seen a wight is shocked as well. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 18.

Everyone except for Qyburn, that is, who steps forward to pick up the still-moving hand and forearm, and beholds it with fascination. With a flint, Davos sparks a torch and hands it to Jon. He takes the hand from Qyburn, ignites it and drops it. T hand dies.
We can destroy them by burning them. (beat) And we can destroy them with dragonglass. He draws a dragonglass dagger.
If we don’t win this fight, then that... He points to the wight’s torso as it crawls toward him wi its single arm.

.-. is the fate of every person in the world. When the wight’s torso reaches him, he picks it up by its remaining wrist, and stabs it with the dragonglass. It deanimates and falls to pieces, ending the demonstration.
There is only one war that matters: the Great War. And it is here. Dany supports Jon's claim:
I didn’t believe it, until I saw them. I saw them all. Cersei looks at her, but finds herself at a rare loss for words.
How many?
A hundred thousand. At least. Cersei weighs what she hears. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 19.
Jon, Tyrion and Dany watch her, hopeful. Euron has stood up, and walked over to the bones of the deanimated wight. He touches it.
Can they swim?
No.
Good. He drops the bone.
I'm taking my fleet back to the Iron Islands. Cersei is taken aback.
What are you talking about?
I’ve been around the world. I’ve seen everything, things you couldn't imagine. And this... He pokes at the wight’s skull with his foot.
This is the only thing I’ve ever seen that terrifies me. He smiles, savoring the thrill of a new feeling, then tur to Dany.
I’m going back to my island. You should go back to yours. When winter’s over, we'll be the only ones left alive. Exit Euron. When Cersei’s surprise at this betrayal recedes, she has something to say.
He’s right to be afraid. And a coward to run. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 20.

If those things come for us, there will be no kingdoms to rule. Everything we’ve suffered will have been for nothing. Everything we’ve lost will have been for nothing. (to Dany) The Crown accepts your truce. Until the dead are defeated, they are the true enemy. The relief is palpable all around. Until Cersei turns to Jon.
In return, the King in the North will extend this truce. He will remain in the North where he belongs, he will not take up arms against the Lannisters. He will not choose sides.
Just the King in the North? Not me?

I would never ask it of you. You would never agree to it, and if you did I would trust you even less than I do now. I ask it only of Ned Stark’s son. I know Ned Stark’s son will be true to his word. Jon looks to the people whose opinions he values most: Da Dany.

I am true to my word, or I try to be. (beat) That is why I cannot give you what you ask. I cannot serve two queens. And I have already pledged myself to Queen Daenerys of House Targaryen. This admission shocks Dany, who can’t believe he would jeopardize the Great War to tell this truth. It shocks everyone else because they had no idea Jon had the knee to Dany in the first place. Cersei stands. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 21.

Then there is nothing left to discuss. The dead will come for the North first. Enjoy dealing with them. We will deal with whatever is left of you. Cersei walks away from the gathering. All the Queensguard Lannister guards follow.
As Jaime passes Brienne on the way out, she stands and follows him toward the exit, talking as she goes.
Ser Jaime.
It’s been good to see you. I imagine the next time will be across a battlefield.
We both saw what just happened. We both saw... that thing.
Yes, I’m not looking forward to seeing more of them. But I’m loyal to the Queen, and you’re loyal to Sansa and her dolt brother, so--
Fuck loyalty! She hits him on his shoulder. Hearing these words come from Brienne’s mouth is enough t stop Jaime in his tracks.
Fuck loyalty?
This goes beyond houses and honor and oaths. Talk to the Queen. Jaime turns to see Cersei in the doorway, watching him st there with Brienne. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 22.
And tell her what? Jaime extricates himself. Brienne watches him as he retur to Cersei’s side, and they disappear from the Dragonpit.

location: WITH THE REST OF THE GROUP

text: Jon faces the reactions to what he’s done.
I wish you hadn’t done that.
I’m grateful for your loyalty. But my dragon died so that we could be here. If it’s all for nothing, then he died for nothing.
I know.
I’m pleased you bent the knee to our Queen. I would have advised it, had you asked. But... have you ever considered learning how to lie? Every now and then, just a bit?

I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want, tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers, only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight.
That is indeed a problem. The more immediate problem is that we're fucked.
Any ideas as to how we might change that state of affairs? (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 23.
Only one. Everyone stays here. And I go and talk to my sister.
I didn’t come all this way to have my Hand murdered.
I don’t want Cersei to murder me either. I could have just stayed in my cell and saved a great deal of trouble.
I did this. I should go.
She'll definitely murder you. Tyrion does appreciate these offers. But:

I go see my sister alone. Or we all go home, and we’re right back where we started. The certainty of his statement brooks no further dissent. Dany nods. Tyrion takes a breath, turns and heads for the exit, alon They all watch him disappear from the Dragonpit.

The Mountain leads Tyrion down a Red Keep corridor, towar Cersei’s chambers. Tyrion looks up at the Mountain, towering over him. The Mountain does not look down at him. His eyes remain straight ahead. Tyrion is deeply regretting this idea. They turn onto
Jaime waits for them here. At the end of the corridor, is closed door. The Mountain goes to stand beside it. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 24.
You spoke with her.
At her. Until she kicked me out. She thinks I was an idiot to trust you. A lot of people seem to think that, actually.
I’m about to step into a room with the most murderous woman in the world, who’s already tried to kill me twice. That I know of. Who’s an idiot?
I suppose we should say goodbye, one idiot to another. Tyrion nods. Gregor opens the door, and Tyrion goes to speak with his sister.

Tyrion enters. Gregor closes the door. Cersei is seated behind her desk, which was once her fath desk, in the office at the far end of the room. Tyrion st the long walk toward her, along the small council table. The Mountain’s heavy footfalls thud behind him. Tyrion st The footsteps stop. Tyrion starts again. When Tyrion reaches the office threshold, the Mountain ta up his post next to the Lannister lion ironwork. Tyrion stands before his sister. Cersei regards him, but not speak.
I shouldn’t be surprised. I suppose she’s your kind of woman: a foreign whore who doesn't know her place.
A foreign whore you can’t abduct, beat or intimidate. That must be difficult for you. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 25.
So you bring her here with her pet Northerner, whom you've convinced to bow down before her--
I did not know about that--
-- and now you’ve got both working towards the same goal. The goal you've worked toward your entire life--
Cersei, I didn’t know--
-- the destruction of this family. It is the same accusation she’s leveled at him for decade He finds it exhausting and exasperating.

I am the one preventing that from happening! Daenerys didn’t want to debate and negotiate. She didn’t want to bring you words, she wanted to bring you fire and blood, until I advised her otherwise. I don’t want to destroy our family. I never have.
You killed our father.
After he sentenced me to death for a crime I didn’t commit. (beat) Yes, I killed him. Hate me for it if you want. I hate myself for it, in spite of what he was, in spite of what he did to me.

Oh, poor little man. Your papa was mean to you. Do you have any idea what you did when you fired that crossbow? You left us open. You laid us bare for the vultures and the vultures came and tore us apart. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 26.

You may not have killed Joffrey, but you killed Myrcella, and you killed Tommen. No one would have touched them if father was here. No one would have dared. The deaths of his niece and nephew pain him deeply.
I have never been more sorry about anything, I--
I will not hear it, not from you--
Please, just let me--
I will not hear it. She means it.
All right. Tyrion stands, and steps over to the threshold of the off where the Mountain stands.
You love your family, and I have destroyed it. I will always be a threat. So put an end to me. The Mountain turns to face him. Tyrion looks up at him, t returns his attentions to Cersei.

If it weren’t for me, you'd have a mother. If it weren’t for me, you'd have a father. If it weren’t for me you'd have two beautiful children. I've thought about killing you more times than I can count. (beat) Do it! Say the word. He’s right. It’s within her grasp, what she’s wanted so b for so long. She looks to the Mountain, who looks to her, waiting for the signal. With a nod of the head she can ha it. She looks away. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 27.

The Mountain turns away, and Tyrion steps away from him. steps over to the side table, picks up a wine vase, and p a glass of wine for himself. He takes a very large drink. He then pours a glass for Cersei, walks over, and sets it down beside her. He returns to the side table for his own wine and resumes a respectful distance on the other side the desk.
I am more sorry about the children than you could ever know.
I will not (hear) --
I don’t care. I loved them. You know I did. You know it in your heart, if there’s anything left of it. She does know. She drinks.
It doesn’t matter. Your love doesn’t matter. Your feelings don’t matter. I don’t care why you did what you did. I only care what it cost us. It cost us our future.
If there’s no future, then why are we here? Why did you allow me to come?
Not to help my enemies collaborate in my destruction.
Yes, no not what you hoped for. But you must have hoped for something. He is more right than he knows. She deflects.
What did you hope for? To make Jon Snow submit to your Queen?
Not like this. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 28.
But eventually. You want everyone to bend the knee to her.
Yes.
Why?
Because I think she will make the world a better place.
You said she'd destroy King’s Landing. She makes a fair point.
She knows herself. She chose an advisor who would check her worst impulses, instead of feeding them. That's the difference between you.
I don’t care about checking my worst impulses. I don’t care about making the world a better place. Hang the world. Cersei folds her hands across her stomach.

That thing you dragged here, I know what it is and I know what it means. And when it came at me, I didn’t think about the world. Not at all. As soon as it opened its mouth, the world disappeared for me, right down its black throat. Tyrion notices the barely perceptible movement of Cersei’ bottom hand over her belly.
All I could think about was keeping those gnashing teeth away from those who mean the most to me. Away from my family. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 29.
Tyrion sees what he sees, and knows what it means. He can hardly believe it, but he knows it to be true.
Maybe Euron Greyjoy had the right idea: get on a boat, take those who matter--
You're pregnant. She stays silent for too long, long enough to tell him th he’s right. And once she knows he knows, she can think of nothing els say.
Jon is pondering, looking at the detritus on the ground, Dany approaches. He has a small dragon jawbone in his han
No one is less happy about this than I am.
I know. I respect what you did. I wish you hadn’t done it, but I respect it. Dany steps closer to Jon and takes the small jawbone from hands. Their fingers touch briefly.

This place was the beginning of the end for my family. (in Valyrian) Zaldrizes buzdari iksos daor. (for Jon's benefit) A dragon is not a slave. They were terrifying, extraordinary, they filled people with wonder and awe. And we locked them in here. They wasted away. They grew small. And we grew small as well. We weren’t extraordinary without them. We were just like everyone else. Dany holds the jawbone out for Jon. He takes it and their fingers touch again. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 30.
He scores
You're not like everyone else. And your family hasn’t seen its end. You're still here.
I can’t have children.
Who told you that?
The witch who murdered my husband.
Has it occurred to you she might not have been a reliable source of information? a small smile.
You were right, from the beginning. If I’d trusted you everything would be different.
So what now?
I can’t forget what I saw north of the Wall. And I can’t pretend that Cersei won’t take back half the country the moment I march north.

It appears Tyrion’s assessment was correct. (clarifying) We're fucked. They allow themselves a brief gallows laugh. The laughter fades, but they continue to hold each others gaze until it is pleasantly uncomfortable. Tyrion’s return to the Dragonpit breaks the moment. Everyone looks at him, steps toward him. He is expressionless, and alone. Crests fall. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 31.
And then Cersei enters behind him, with Jaime, Qyburn, th Mountain and the Queensguard in tow. Varys reenters as we

My armies will not stand down. I will not pull them back to the capital. (beat) I will march them north, to fight alongside you in the Great War. The darkness is coming for us all. We will face it together. This is the last thing anyone expected to hear. Dany and both look at Tyrion. Tyrion meets their gaze with a subtle expression: Tyrion Lannister, motherfuckers.
And when the Great War is over, perhaps you will remember I chose to help with no promises or assurances from any of you. (beat) I expect not. She turns to Qyburn and gives the order:
Call our banners. All of them. Exit Cersei.
The blizzard has reached gothic proportions. A lone raven battles the strong winds and tumbling snow. In the distance, the towers of Winterfell are barely visi through the storm.
SANSA STARK sits at Jon’s desk, tapping the wood with the unrolled raven scroll. LITTLEFINGER stands on the other side of the desk. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 32.
Even with a fire burning brightly in the fireplace and th windows boarded up, it’s obviously freezing in here, and of them are bundled against the cold.
It’s not easy for ravens to fly in these storms. Perhaps Jon tried to send word earlier--
No. This is the way he is. The way he’s always been. He never asks my opinion. Why would he start now?
I can’t believe he’d surrender the Northern crown without consulting you--
(holding up scroll) This is his writing! His signature! He pledged to fight for Daenerys Targaryen. He bent the knee! Littlefinger moves about the room, examining an ancient F Men carving of a wolf.
I've heard gossip that the Dragon Queen is quite beautiful.
What does that have to do with anything?
Jon is young and unmarried. Daenerys is young and unmarried. Sansa stares at him in disbelief.
You think he wants to marry her?
An alliance makes sense. Together they'd be difficult to defeat. He lets that thought sink in for Sansa, before continuing (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 33.
He was named King in the North. He can be unnamed. Sansa glances at Littlefinger and looks away. to turn that far against her brother?
Even if I wanted to... Arya would never go along. She’s always loved Jon. Far more than she ever loved me. And she’d kill anyone who betrayed her family.
You're her family, too. Would Arya really murder her own sister?
Do you know what she is now? Do you know what the Faceless Men are?
Only by reputation. They worship the God of Death, I believe. (shrugging) I never trust godly men.
They're killers. And Arya was one of them. (beat) What do you think she’s after?
She’s your sister. You know her far better than I ever could. He watches Sansa for a long beat.

Sometimes, when I’m trying to understand a person’s motives, I play a little game. I assume the worst. What's the worst reason they could possibly have for saying what they say, and doing what they do? Then I ask myself: how well does that reason explain what they say and what they do? So tell me: What is the worst thing she could want? Is she willing (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 34.
She could want me dead because she thinks I wronged my family.
Why did she come to Winterfell?
To kill me. For marrying our enemies and betraying my family.
Why did she unearth the letter Cersei made you write?
To provide proof of my betrayals. To provide justification, after she murders me.
And after she murders you, what does she become? Sansa looks up at him.
Lady of Winterfell. Littlefinger spreads his hands. Well? There it is. Sansa nods. There it is.
Tyrion, Jon, Dany, Davos, Jorah, Grey Worm, Missandei, Va and Theon have gathered for this conference. Jon uses the table to point out routes.
If we have the Dothraki ride hard on the Kingsroad, they'll arrive at Winterfell within a fortnight.
And the Unsullied? (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 35.
We can sail with them to White Harbor and meet the Dothraki here on the Kingsroad, then ride together to Winterfell.

Perhaps you should fly to Winterfell, your grace. You have many enemies in the North. Thousands fell fighting your father. All it takes is one angry man with a crossbow-- he’1ll see your silver hair on the Kingsroad and know that one well-placed bolt will make him a hero. The Man Who Killed the Conqueror. Dany sees the logic in this. But before she can speak:

It’s your decision, your grace. But if we’re going to be allies in this war, it’s important for the Northerners to see us as allies. If we sail to White Harbor together, I think it sends a better message. She weighs her choice, then says to Jorah:
I’ve not come to conquer the North. I’m coming to save the North. She turns to Jon.

We sail together. Jon doesn’t quite smile because smiling would seem inappropriate. But still, that almost looks like a smile. Jorah nods in deference. But he’s not smiling at all. Fuc punkass little shitburger stole my khaleesi! Dany looks over the map table, in a shot reminiscent of t end of episode 701.
As Jon and Davos walk away from the meeting, Theon catche with them. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the
Jon. Jon and Davos stop and look at him.
Could I speak with you? Wolf" 36. Jon considers him for a beat before nodding to Davos. Dav nods in return and walks away.
What you did in King’s Landing... what you said... Jon isn’t sure what Theon’s talking about and Theon himse struggles to make himself clear.
You could have lied to Cersei. About bending the knee to Daenerys. You risked everything, to tell an enemy the truth.
We went down there to make peace. And it seems to me we need to be honest with each other if we’re going to fight together. Theon stares at the floor. He hates himself in this momen he truly does.
You've always known what was right. Even when we were all young and stupid, you always knew. Every step you take, it’s always the right step.
It's not. It may seem that way from the outside, but I promise you, it's not true. I've done plenty of things that I regret.
Not compared to me, you haven't. Jon thinks about it.
No, not compared to you. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 37.

I always wanted to do the right thing, be the right kind of person. But I never knew what that meant. Theon is close to tears and Jon watches him, sympathy fighting with his revulsion for the man who betrayed his family.
It always seemed like there was... like there was an impossible choice I had to make. Stark or Greyjoy.
Our father was more of a father to you than yours ever was.
He was.
And you betrayed him. Betrayed his memory.
I did.
But you never lost him. He’s a part of you. Just like he’s a part of me. Theon looks up at Jon.
But the things I’ve done...
It's not my place to forgive you for all of it. But what I can forgive, I do. You don't need to choose. You're a Greyjoy. And you're a Stark. Theon is deeply moved. For a moment he can’t speak.
When I was Ramsay’s prisoner, Yara tried to save me. She’s the only one who tried to save me. (beat) She needs me now. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 38.
So why are you still talking to me?

The IRONBORN prepare to set sail, with HARRAG giving orde The Ironborn quiet down when they see Theon approaching. Theon faces the men, whose expressions are flat and hosti Whatever natural leadership abilities Theon once possesse he lost them a long time ago.
All of us chose to follow Yara. We left the Iron Islands for Yara. She would never leave one of us behind. We're not leaving her behind.
Your sister’s dead.
She’s not dead.
She's dead. Even if Euron hasn't cut her throat yet, she’s dead.
She’s our queen--
She’s your sister. And you left her to die. The men nod. Little shit abandoned his own sister.
I did. I ran from my uncle. I was a coward. Harrag steps closer to him.
So why in fuck’s name should we listen to you? They say the dead can’t swim. We’re gonna sail east, find a nice quiet island, kill all the men and take their wives for ourselves. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 39.
We're done with all that.
Who says we are?

Yara did. She made a pledge. We’re going to find her. And we’re going to set her free. Harrag spits in his face, a great gob of slimy, Ironborn spittle. Theon closes his eyes and wipes the spit from his face.

Run away, little Theon. That’s what you do best. Theon doesn’t respond. But he doesn’t look away from Harr Harrag, a pit bull of a human being, finds this look provocative. He punches Theon in the face, hard. Theon fights back. It’s not a pretty fight. Harrag brawls dirty, all elbows and head butts. He wears heavy rings on his fingers, rings he paid the ir price for, and these do extra damage with each punch he lands. Theon fights with great heart, but he’s smaller and less experienced at this type of street fighting. He lands a few shots but none of them seem to affect his opponent. Harrag knocks him down with a vicious cross, opening a ga just above Theon’s eye. The men cheer. Theon staggers to his feet, blood streaming down over his eye. Harrag attacks again. Theon tries to defend himself but i overpowered. Theon goes down again. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 40.
This time the cheers are a bit sparser. Harrag pants as he stares down at Theon. The big man is getting winded.

Stay down or I’1l kill you. Theon-- bleeding from the nose, the mouth, from the deep above his eye-- rises to his feet again. He’s having a hard time seeing, he’s so bloodied. But he throws himself at Harrag, trying to land a good shot. Harrag knocks him down a third time. Harrag himself is so exhausted now he bends over, hands o his knees, watching Theon. The Ironborn watch Theon, too. He might not be the world’ greatest fighter. But fuck, he’s not quitting. Theon, his face a bloody mess, rises to his feet a third time. Harrag takes a deep breath. He charges at Theon, throwing everything he’s got left at his adversary. Clutching Theon’s face in his big, dirty hands, Harrag sl his knee into Theon’s groin. But Theon has no balls. Just the slightest possible smile from Theon, as he recei his first ever benefit from castration. He slams his forehead into Harrag’s nose, the single grea headbutt in the history of filmed headbutts. Harrag staggers back, hands covering the streaming mess o his nose. Theon tackles him and proceeds to ground and pound the li shit out of the big man, who is too tired to defend himse Soon Harrag lies motionless on the beach. Theon stands. He looks like he’s just been spat out of a thresher. He nearly falls but one of the Ironborn men catches him a holds him. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 41.
Theon looks over the men. They’re simple men. They just l to see their leaders bleed for them. Theon spits out a gob of blood and nods.
Not for me. For Yara.
He nods and heads for the skiffs. The Ironborn follow.

Sansa stands alone, staring across the snow-shrouded moor She wears a hood to protect her from the wind and the sno making her look like the French Lieutenant’s Woman, a reference Sophie Turner will just have to Google. We don’t have access to her interior monologue, but we’re looking at Dark Sansa here, that much is clear. She closes her eyes for a beat, then opens them. The decision has been made. She turns and walks back toward the towers. As she passes a waiting STARK GUARD:
Have my sister brought to the great hall. The Guard nods and Sansa keeps walking, never looking bac never checking her stride.

ARYA STARK walks into the great hall, escorted by two STA GUARDS. Sansa sits at the high table. Bran sits by her side, in h wheelchair. He watches Arya with no trace of brotherly affection. MAESTER WOLKAN stands near the high table. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 42.

LORD ROYCE stands on one side of the room, and dozens of KNIGHTS OF THE VALE stand by the walls, watching Arya. Arya glances at the Knights of the Vale on either side of her. Far more men than she could kill, and all of them lo to Sansa. She sees Littlefinger leaning against the wall, in the sa position where he stood at the end of 610. Watching Arya the faintest trace of a smile. Not a good sign, Arya. She glances behind her as the door shut and Knights of the Vale fill the gap. Surrounded on sides. The room is very quiet. Arya looks at her sister.
Are you sure you want to do this? A beat before Sansa replies.
It’s not what I want. It’s what honor demands. Arya smiles.
And what does honor demand?

That I defend my family from those who would harm us. That I defend the north from those who would betray us. Arya nods. She glances at Littlefinger, who stares back a her. She looks at Lord Royce. No love there. Bran, her ba brother? Nothing.
All right, then. Get on with it.
You stand accused of murder. You stand accused of treason. Sansa’s eyeline shifts.
How do you answer these charges, Lord Baelish? (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 43.
Littlefinger stiffens, as everyone in the room looks at h Everyone else is in on it. For once, Littlefinger is the on the outside. As if caught in a bad dream, he cannot speak for a moment
My sister asked you a question.
Lady Sansa... forgive me. I’m a bit confused--

Which charges confuse you? Let’s start with the simplest one. You murdered our aunt, Lysa Arryn. You pushed her through the Moon Door and watched her fall. Do you deny it? Littlefinger stares at her, unable to process what's happening. He turns and sees Lord Royce staring coldly at him.
I did it to protect you--

You did it to take power in the Vale. Earlier you conspired to murder Jon Arryn. You gave Lysa Tears of Lys to poison him. Do you deny it? Littlefinger opens his mouth but cannot speak for a beat. does she know this?
Whatever your aunt might have told you... she was a troubled woman. She imagined enemies everywhere.

You had Aunt Lysa send a letter to our parents, telling them it was the Lannisters who murdered Jon Arryn. When really it was you. Littlefinger is one of the coolest cucumbers in the garde but even he starts to sweat now. His prosecutor is armed information she cannot possibly know. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 44.
The conflict between the Starks and the Lannisters, it was you who started it. Do you deny it?
I know of no such letter.

You conspired with Cersei Lannister and Joffrey Baratheon to betray our father, Ned Stark. Thanks to your treachery he was imprisoned and later executed on false charges of treason. Do you deny it? The walls are closing in on Littlefinger. But he’s not go down without a fight.
I deny it. None of you were there to see what happened. None of you knows the truth--

You held a knife to his throat. You said, “I did warn you not to trust me.” Littlefinger looks at Bran. And now he understands how al his crimes have come to light. Arya draws the Valyrian steel dagger.
You told our mother this knife belonged to Tyrion Lannister. But that was another one of your lies. It was yours. Littlefinger sees the steel glint in the torchlight. He turns back to Sansa.
Lady Sansa. I’ve known you since you were a girl. I’ve protected you--
Protected me? By selling me to the Boltons? (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 45.
If we could speak alone, I can explain everything.

Sometimes, when I’m trying to understand a person’s motives, I play a little game. I assume the worst. What's the worst reason you have for turning me against my sister? But that’s what you do, isn’t it? That’s what you've always done. Turn family against family, turn sister against sister. That’s what you did to our mother and Aunt Lysa. And that’s what you tried to do to us.
Sansa. Please.
I’m a slow learner, it’s true. But I learn.
Give me a chance to defend myself. I deserve that. Seeing no hint of mercy on Sansa’s face he turns to Lord Royce.
I am Lord Protector of the Vale and I command you to escort me safely back to the Eyrie. Lord Royce stares at Littlefinger. He would behead the ma himself, but it’s not his place.
I think not. Littlefinger realizes too late that the best laid plans g aft agley, an' lea'e us nought but grief an' pain. He sinks to his knees.
Sansa. I beg you. I loved your mother since the time I was a boy. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 46.
And yet you betrayed her.
I loved you more than anyone.
And yet you betrayed me. Sansa stands.

When you brought me back to Winterfell, you told me there’s no justice in the world. Not unless we make it. She nods to Arya. Littlefinger glances at the Stark girl, who now walks tow him, a petite executioner, dagger in hand.
Thank you for all your many lessons, Lord Baelish. I will never forget them.

Sansa-— Arya swipes the dagger across his throat so fast he doesn see it happening until it's over. He falls face forward to the floor, clutching at his thro trying to keep his life blood from spilling out. Everyone in the great hall watches him die. And no one mo a muscle to help him.
Jaime is in the midst of giving orders to LANNISTER GENER

Our men in King’s Landing will march north in three days time. As Jaime continues to speak, we cut to the second level o the large room. Cersei, trailed by the Mountain, approach the balcony looking over the huge painted map and looks d at the men below. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 47.
It‘ll take us a fortnight just to gather supplies for the train--
We don’t have a fortnight. If the north falls, we fall. Three days. Cersei steps away from the balcony and moves for the stai followed by the Mountain.
The remaining forces in the Westerlands will take the River Road east. We’1l meet at Lord Harroway’s Town, and march together to Winterfell.
Ser Jaime. Jaime glances over to where Cersei now approaches, traile her fearsome bodyguard.
Your grace.

My lords. I need a moment with my brother. The Generals bow to their queen and depart. Cersei waits for them to go before turning on Jaime. The Mountain waits at a respectful distance, always watch Jaime.
What are you doing?
Preparing the expedition north.

The expedition north. (beat) I always knew you were the stupidest Lannister. Jaime opens his mouth but quickly closes it. Painful experience has taught him not to interrupt Cersei when sh about to begin a rant. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 48.
The Starks and Targaryens have united against us-- and you want to fight alongside them? Are you a traitor or an idiot?
You pledged our forces [to fight our common ]--

(speaking over him) I will say whatever I need to say to insure the survival of our House. You expect me to trust the man who murdered our father? You expect me to command our troops to fight beside foreign scum? To fight for the Dragon Queen?
You saw it with your own eyes. You saw a dead man trying to kill us.
And I saw it burn. If dragons can’t stop them, if Dothraki and Unsullied and Northmen can’t stop them, how will our army make a difference?
This isn’t about noble houses. This is about the living and the dead--
And I intend to stay amongst the living! Let the Stark boy and his new queen defend the north. We stay here, where we’ve always been.
I made a promise-- She approaches him, trying a gentler tack, looking up at bewildered face.
Our child will rule Westeros.
Our child will never be born, if the dead come south. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 49.

The monsters are real. The White walkers. The dragons. The Dothraki screamers-- all the frightening stories we heard when we were young, they’re all real. So be it. Let the monsters kill each other. While they battle in the north, we'll take back the lands that belong to us.
And then what?
And then we rule.

When the fight in the north is over, someone wins. You understand that, don’t you? If the dead win, they march south and kill us all. If the living win and we've betrayed them, they march south and kill us all.
The Targaryens and the Starks already want to kill us all. Most of them will die in the north.
I faced them in the field. We can’t beat them. We can’t beat their dragons--
How many dragons did you see at the pit? Jaime’s not sure what she’s getting at.
Two.
What happened to the third?
For all we know it’s guarding her fleet. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 50.

(shaking her head) She came here with her dragons and her Dothraki and her Unsullied -- she came to show us all her power. No, something happened. The dragons are vulnerable. Cersei’s intransigence frustrates Jaime. He’s battled the forces on the field. He knows what they’re up against.
We can’t beat the Dothraki. We don’t have the numbers, we don’t have the support of the other houses.
We have something better. We have the Iron Bank. Jaime can only stare at her.

You should have listened more when father spoke about the importance of gold. Oh, I know it was boring for you. You just wanted to hunt and ride and fight. But I listened. I learned. (beat) Highgarden bought us the most powerful army in Essos. The Golden Company. 20,000 men, horses... elephants, I believe.
The Golden Company is not here. They are in Essos. How is a mercenary company in Essos going to help us?
Did you really think Euron Greyjoy turned tail and sailed back to the Iron Islands? Do you think he abandoned the chance to marry the Queen? A beat. Jaime really did believe it. (CONTINUED )
Jaime cons sister, hi [RONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 51. (5)
No one walks away from me. He’s sailing with his fleet to Essos. He’s going to ferry the Golden Company back here to help us win the war for Westeros.
You plotted with Euron Greyjoy. Without telling me. The commander of your armies.
And you conspired with Tyrion, the man who murdered our father. Without telling me. Your queen.
I didn’t conspire with him!
You met him in secret, without my consent. You planned to promote my enemies’ interests. That is the definition of conspiracy.
I pledged to ride north. I intend to honor that pledge.
And that would be treason.
Treason?!
Disobeying your Queen’s command. Fighting with her enemies. What would you call it? iders his response for a long beat, staring at his s lover, his queen.
It doesn’t matter what I’d call it. He turns to go but finds that the Mountain stands directl his way.
I told you no one walks away from me. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 52.
Jaime turns and looks at her again.
Are you going to order him to kill me? Cersei stares at him.
I’m the only one you have left. Our children are gone. Our father is gone. It’s just me and you now.
There’s one more yet to come. Jaime nods.

Give the order, then. He watches her and waits. The Mountain waits for a command from his queen. She nods. The smallest possible nod. The Mountain draws his sword. Jaime knows there’s no point fighting. He knows he will b cut in half. He stares at his sister for a long beat.
(quiet) I don’t believe you. After a long beat, Jaime turns and walks away, right past Mountain and his drawn sword. Cersei watches. She does not give the command.

Jaime rides north, the city behind him. He’s no longer wearing his Lannister uniform. He’s no lon commanding an army, or representing his house. He’s dress so as not to stand out, in the manner of Bronn, a sellswo with no affiliations. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 53.

He glances down at his golden hand, a hand that makes him famous throughout Westeros. Stopping his horse, he pulls black leather glove (specially designed for his golden ha As he finishes he notices a single snowflake landing on t black leather. He looks up at the overcast sky. He glances back at the capital, and the high towers of the Red Keep. He trots forward, never looking back again, a lone horsem heading north on the Kingsroad. EXT. KING’S LANDING - LOCATIONS - NIGHT We watch the snow fall in various locations we've visited the past. The dragon pit, the map room, etc.

Sam and Gilly’s horse-drawn wagon pulls into the Winterfe courtyard. SAMWELL TARLY, GILLY and LITTLE SAM take in their surroundings. They sure have traveled the world together. INT. BRAN’S CHAMBER - NIGHT Bran sits in his wheelchair, staring at nothing. A fire roars in the fireplace. A knock on the door.
Come in. Sam enters.
Samwell Tarly. Sam smiles.
I wasn’t sure if you’d remember me.
I remember everything. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 54.
Hm. A bit odd. Oh well. Sam closes the door behind him.
You helped us get beyond the Wall. You’re a good man.
Oh, well. Thank you. I’m not sure that I am. (beat) What happened to you, beyond the Wall?
I became the Three Eyed Raven.
Oh. (beat) I don’t know what that means.
I can see things that happened in the past. I can see things happening now, all over the world. An outlandish claim, but Sam believes it.
Why did you come to Winterfell?
Jon's the one to lead the fight against the dead. I know he is. But he can’t do it alone. So I’ve come here to help him. Bran weighs this, and deems it acceptable.
He’s on his way back to Winterfell. With Daenerys Targaryen.
You-- you saw this, in a vision? Bran holds up the raven scroll reporting Jon's and Dany’s arrival.
Oh. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 55.
He needs to know the truth.
The truth about what?

About himself. No one knows. No one but me. Jon isn't really my father's son. He's the son of Rhaegar Targaryen and my aunt, Lyanna Stark. Sam stares at Bran for a long beat. What he’s just heard, true, is news that changes everything. Bran looks away.
He was born in a tower in Dorne. His last name isn’t really Snow. It’s Sand. Sam puts everything together. Holy shit.
It’s not. Bran’s not truly capable of surprise anymore, but he’s confused now.
Dornish bastards are named Sand.
At the Citadel, I transcribed a High Septon’s diary. (beat) He annulled Rhaegar’s marriage to Elia. This is something Bran didn’t know.
He wed Rhaegar and Lyanna, in a secret ceremony. Close on Bran, as he realizes what this means.
Are you certain? (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 56.

It’s what the High Septon wrote in his private diary. I don’t know why he’d lie. Is this something you can see? We go extremely close on Bran, his eyes wide open. When we pull back, we realize we’re no longer in Bran’s r We're in:

Bran watches RHAEGAR TARGARYEN, silver-haired, tall and handsome. He stands by LYANNA STARK, both of them nervous but happy. Lyanna looks up into Rhaegar’s eyes as HIGH SEPTON MAYNAR binds their hands with the wedding wrap in a ceremony tha should look quite similar to the marriage of Robb Stark a Talisa. Their love for each other would be obvious to any bystand Bran stands close by, watching them say the words:

Father. Smith. Warrior. Father. Smith. Warrior. Mother. Maiden. Crone. Mother. Maiden. Crone. Stranger. I am hers, and she Stranger. I am his, and he i is mine, from this day, until mine, from this day, until the end of my days. the end of my days.
Robert’s Rebellion was built on a lie. The two young lovers kiss, hopeful newlyweds who truly believe this will all work out.
Rhaegar didn't kidnap my aunt, or rape her.
A hand closes into a fist before a carved wooden door. A beautiful door, fit for a queen. The hand raises: Jon’s hand. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 57.
He loved her. Jon hesitates for a beat. He knocks. A moment later Dany opens the door and stares at him. For a moment they just look at each other.
And she loved him. Then Dany stands aside and Jon enters the room. At the far end of the corridor, Tyrion watches from the stairway, and sees Dany’s door closing behind Jon Snow.
Lyanna in bed, bleeding, with Young Ned beside her, in th shots from Season 6, but this time Bran stands right next the bed, close enough to hear Lyanna whisper.
And Jon... Jon’s real name...
His name is Aegon Targaryen. You have to protect him. Promise me, Ned.
We crawl up the swirling bedclothes to Dany and Jon, making love. Jon is on top.
He’s never been a bastard. Their faces are inches apart. Their eyes are wide open.
He’s the heir to the Iron Throne. They kiss.
Tyrion watches Dany’s closed door. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 58.
Looking troubled for more reasons than one, he turns away enters his own cabin and shuts the door behind him.
He needs to know.
We need to tell him. Dany's ship makes its way north, toward White Harbor, the dragon-emblazoned sails fluttering in the moonlight.
The storm has passed. Sansa and Arya look out across the snowy landscape. Arya looks up at her big sister.
Are you all right? Sansa nods.
It’s just strange. (beat) In his own horrible way, I believe he loved me. Arya shrugs. She doesn’t have any angst about it.
You did the right thing.
You did it.
I’m just the executioner. You passed the sentence. You’re the Lady of Winterfell. Sansa glances at her.
Does that bother you? Arya shakes her head. Nope. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 59.
I was never going to be as good a lady as you. So I had to be something else. (beat) I never could have survived what you survived.
You would have. You’re the strongest person I know. Arya looks at her big sister again.
I believe that’s the nicest thing you've ever said to me.
Well. Don’t get used to it. You’re still very strange and annoying. Arya smiles. She stares north with Sansa.
In winter, we must protect ourselves, look after one another. Sansa knows those words.
Father. Arya nods. He said it all so many times, they know it by heart.
When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives. They are silent for a beat.
I miss him.
Me too. We crane up and away from the Stark sisters.  GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 60.
We crane down from the weirwood's leaves to find Bran sit at the base of the tree, his eyes rolled back.

As before, we fly to the Wall with a flock of birds, pilo by Bran. A bunch of them land on the Wall battlements abo Eastwatch. TORMUND walks the battlements, gazing north for the enemy knows is coming. He looks down the battlements to BERIC, who is up here wi him, along with a few other WILDLINGS. They’ve all taken to the strange role of serving as guardians of the Wall.
It’s a long way down.

Eh. Crows keep telling me I’1l get used to it. A few NIGHT’S WATCHMEN are up here as well. Tormund hears a strange sound, getting louder. He looks d to the north side of the Wall. Beric looks as well.

location: EASTWATCH, NORTH SIDE OF THE WALL

text: Emerging from the frozen coastal forest, the ARMY OF THE comes in force. All of them, 100,000 strong, with hundred WHITE WALKER officer corps on their dead horses.
One of the Night’s Watchmen runs to the large horn and bl three times.

location: EASTWATCH, NORTH SIDE OF THE WALL

text: The Army of the Dead halts in the no-man’s-land between t forest and the Wall, the Walkers on their dead horses in front of the wight foot soldiers. (CONTINUED )

“The Dragon and the Wolf" 61. Tormund exhales, looks to Beric. It's true, that whole th about them being unable to pass the Wall because of ancie spells and such. He’ll live another day. But then a stranger sound comes from the north. Tormund l to the sky, and sees a mote on the horizon, coming in fas Very fast. It's moving so fast we don't get a clear look at it or th NIGHT KING on its back before
it is upon us...

..-hitting the Wall with a blast of blue flame. Bran's meaningful birds take flight. A massive chunk of the Wall breaks free ahead of Tormund. ice dragon glides away, and we get our first clear look a him, and at the Night King on his back. He's done the same thing to Viserion that he did to Craster's sons. Only tho were babies, and this is a dragon.

(shouting a command) Run! Run! Tormund and Beric lead their wildling comrades to the sta carved in the ice -- Eastwatch has a massive zig-zag stairway, not an elevator like Castle Black. They run for their lives and disappear from view.
The Night King and his dragon kill. Hovering near the base of the forth a steady stream of blue strafing back and forth along The Wall cannot withstand the

circle back, coming in for the Wall, the ice dragon shoots fire, thick as a tree trunk, the base of the Wall. fire. Thunderously, it begins to give way, sending pieces falling into the sea like a calving iceberg. (CONTINUED )
GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 62.

We see a few Wildling stragglers who didn’t make it down time fall hundreds of feet to their death. The ice dragon keeps blasting until a huge breach has bee opened, one large enough to admit the Army of the Dead, a 100,000 of them. And the White Walkers. And the Night Kin flying low over their heads, into the camera -- -- and away from it. All of them heading south, for the w of men.
